definition: single-component character
alone/independent/single/sole/only
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: These are all single characters and are easy to identify.
sentences.chinese: 这些汉字都是独体字，比较好辨认。

definition: component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
a Chinese character formed by combining existing elements - i.e. a combined ideogram 會意|会意 or radical plus phonetic 形聲|形声
radical of a Chinese character
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
phono-semantic compound character
combined ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character that combines the meanings of existing elements/also known as joint ideogram or associative compounds
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
character root/word root/etymon
single Chinese character/word (in a foreign language)
semantic component of a phono-semantic character (e.g. component刂[dao1] in 刻[ke4])
stroke order (when writing Chinese character)
乚 stroke in Chinese characters
variant Chinese character
(colloquial) grapheme 攵 (variant form of Kangxi radical 66, 攴)
character with two or more readings
old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
